data.title: playtest: "Invalid <Option>" when loading this map in multiplayer
data.body:
Hey,
made[ this map](http://resource.openra.net/maps/22831/) which works fine in playtest20170902 skirmish. No playtest Lint errors. (some random warnings)
In multiplayer however I can't choose techlevel or AI, even though that is perfectly possible in skirmish mode. 
EDIT: I can choose low or medium tech, but no idea why. I reconfigured all techlevels after all.

21:15:20 - pchote: interesting
21:15:27 - pchote: seems to be related to the resource center fetching
...
21:33:58 - pchote: afaik none of the code related to this bug has changed recently
...
21:34:57 - pchote: the key point is that this only happens when a dedicated server doesn't have the map installed

data.title: Add GrantConditionByDisguisedActor and Unhardcode Disguise TargetType
data.body:
First commit fixes a part of #13765.

Second commit adds a GrantConditionByDisguisedActor trait. Similiar to what Cargo has, you can make Disguised actor get a condition depending on what it disguised as. In the future WithDisguisingInfantryBody can be scrapped and replaced by these conditions, i keep it for now tho and only add support.

I added a TESTCASE for second commit, it makes it so Spy's eye icon will only be shown for Rifle, Gren, Rocket or Tanya and not other infantries.

data.title: Fix RA effect warhead submarine interaction
data.body:
Fixes #14054.
Fixes #14056.

data.title: Mouse scrolling inconsistencies
data.body:
Reported on IRC as an issue in the current playtests:

> 22:30 <Hezkore> Yeah I have that version. But it seems OpenRA checks each frame if the mouse has moved enough to be trigger a "scroll" depending on the previous frames mouse position, but it should really compare against the mouse positions from the previous "scroll" position
> 22:31 <Hezkore> With the current setup, if you move your mouse slowly (with right mouse button down scrolling) it doesn't ever scroll
22:34 <Hezkore> http://hezkore.com/captures/x_u1505770362.mp4

data.title: DepthCharge has no CreateEffect animation when hitting a surfaced submarine.
data.body: The DepthCharge projectile just disappears when it hits a surfaced submarine. The large_splash effect should still trigger when missing a target.

data.title: Added a tooltip that displays the networth of the resource patch under cursor in the map editor
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9477.

data.title: Submerged submarines are damaged by surface fire.
data.body:
This is caused by the addition of "Water" to the SS & MSUB underwater TargetTypes.
I think simply removing "Water" from the SS & MSUB Underwater TargetTypes should fix this.
SS & MSUB:
->Targetable@UNDERWATER:
-->TargetTypes: **Water**, Underwater, Repair

[playtest-20170902 & bleed]

data.title: Draw range circles in the map editor preview
data.body: Wished at both https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12522 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9935.

data.title: voices for each sub-faction in RA?
data.body: would be cool to have the Germans speak in German, etc... just a thought

data.title: tiberium dawn tree infect/grow tile?
data.body:
1. when are we going to get the tree infection?
would be cool to see this feature implemented in a way that it would be optional
like map makers could add trees that are infect able and ones that aren't

2. would like to see a tile/object that slowly grows Tiberium thats is placed by maps makers  and or is created by the Tiberium its-self 

basically this tile would act as Tiberium roots

"No matter how small, an isolated patch of Tiberium can spread to cover acres. The process is not entirely understood, but it is believed that a patch of Tiberium will release underground shoots in every direction, which will then grow into Tiberium proper. In this way, the amount of Tiberium in an area will increase exponentially. Tiberium patches can be completely de-'forested' temporarily, but will grow back even if the Tiberium is completely removed, due to its underground "roots", as well as smaller crystals, that will remain in the soil and become clusters for further crystalline growth. As such, the ground from which Tiberium grows sounds like shattered glass when walked on" http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Tiberium

data.title: sell delay?
data.body:
the title is self-explanatory

-basically gives a player the chance to capture structures of a enemy base he has occupied with his army and not have to deal with the BS of having his opponent selling off structures just as hes about to cap it

data.title: A-move/alt command for engie/hijacker/mechanic?
data.body:
you know how if you alt right click a apc with infantry selected they will fill up that apc and then any apc's near that one?

could we have that logic applied to mechanics with husks?

and maybe even with hijackers with enemy vehicles(or we could just have it be a A-move command)

then i would like to see something similar with engineers A-move/or alt command with enemy buildings or neutrals  (since defensive stance is changing the game in a way that this kind of command would be helpful) and not require you to right click every building

data.title: Fix SpriteEffect not updating ScreenMap
data.body:
Fixes #14047.

As additional safe-guarding against zero-bounds, the adding/removing in ScreenMap was tweaked as well, now it only adds effects if W/H are not 0.

data.title: Game crashes if a SpriteEffect starts with an empty frame
data.body:
Regression from #13979.

The problem will be the fact that compressed shp(ts) files with empty first frame return an `Animation.Image` size of `0, 0`.

One possible solution would be to check for the largest frame of the animation and return that as `Animation.LargestImage` so we can pass that to the ScreenMap to calculate the bounds, but I'm not sure what performance impact this approach might have.

data.title: Replace dcliff0* templates with ramps.
data.body: This does the terrain manipulation, but omits the actor creation -- that requires a new trait for rendering tile-based artwork, which then really should be used to deduplicate / clean up the bib and legacy bridge rendering.  That's a can of worms that I'm not interested in opening.  68d3d87851e69917dd1a105d1068f9d18ddc8bb4 provides a starting point for the actor setup for whoever wants to tackle that task in the future.

data.title: Dependency fetch and OpenRA.Test.csproj reference different versions of NUnit
data.body:
The script to fetch dependencies grabs NUnit3. The OpenRA.Test.csproj references NUnit2. Those versions of NUnit are incompatible, and this causes headaches trying to get the unit tests to run in visual studio.
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps.ps1#L59
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Test/OpenRA.Test.csproj#L40

I'm assuming the .csproj should be updated to reference nunit 3.

data.title: AutoTargetPriorities + AttackGarrisoned interactions aren't exactly modder-friendly.
data.body:
AutoTargetPriorities can be nicely utilized to imitate the threat-rating logic of TS's, however for TR logic, a modder might need to setup a complicated passenger-condition setup (especially when multiple passenger slots are present).

A good alternative would be to create some sort of an ATP interface and then Cargo/AttackGarrisoned (or a different trait) could gather the ATP interfaces and return the summaries to the transport actor for use with AutoTarget.

data.title: Streaming Wav and Voc audio.
data.body:
Followup to #13521.

This allows the Wav and Voc classes to provide actual streaming data for their audio, rather than having to load it into memory and return a `MemoryStream`. This means we can leave the file sitting on disk, rather than it sitting in memory. Mods using these audio types will therefore require less memory.

Tested Wavs successfully in RA2. I haven't tested Voc but hopefully the changes can be verified by inspection, they're not too bad.

data.title: Fix cheats reenabling OneShot support powers.
data.body: Fixes a regression from #12859: enabling cheats would reactivate the GPS countdown and let it be manually targeted.

data.title: Allow removal of auto-arrangement of players with the map.yaml
data.body:
The default arrangement of players when spawns has not been selected helps sorting out spawns for players either not familiar or caring with the lobby's spawn selection system. At the same time it also takes away opportunities for play with maps having more spawn than players that allows the player the excitement of exploring the map in order to locate the enemy.

![examples](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2715583/30519889-955a0f1c-9ba1-11e7-85b4-c1a44b558122.png) Using examples of the official map pool.

This option would also help competitive players with all mods to expand their selection of maps going beyond 1v1 maps. At the start-up of the RA Global League a few 2v2 maps was added to the map pool only to later realize the players by default spawning on polar opposite sides on the maps.

data.title: Added map Grassy Knoll
data.body: Another map that should be not too fancy #12518 and playable already. First map to add `CAHOSP` and `CAARMR`. http://resource.openra.net/maps/22847/

Another map that is rather small, quite open and all bridges are optional. #12518
Uploaded at  http://resource.openra.net/maps/22846/ as well.

data.title: Fix height calculations in custom terrain layers.
data.body: These were not updated in #13253.  This fixes the altitude drop when units cross a bridge / enter a tunnel / start flying.

data.title: Generals and Emperor Dune?
data.body: I am curious if, once Tiberian Sun and Red Alert 2 are done and the engine is much closer to how the team wants it to be, will you move on to add 3D support and do games like CNC Generals and Emperor Battle for Dune?

data.title: Streamline turret render traits - part 2
data.body:
My idea for making #13619 more flexible is to use integer priority values instead of a single boolean, but even independently from that, our current turret render traits are a bit of a mess, especially when it comes to anything dealing with "aiming" at a target.
This needs to be sorted out first to avoid problems and work-arounds in #13619.

This PR straightens out that mess, so that both #13619 as well as any future additional `WithTurret*Animation` traits should have an easier time to do what they're intended to do without implicit conflicts or compatibility issues.

data.body: See also https://ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=530408 for reference.

data.title: Multiplayer game start countdown
data.body:
Mentioned in #5704 and #3519 and various other issues, but not directy.

There should be a 3 (5? Feels too long as how it was implemented in StarCraft) seconds after everyone checks ready. The game should become unavailable from the lobby to prevent spectators appearing in the game right before it starts.

data.title: Starting the game while a map change is ordered kicks player
data.body:
The map change seems to take quite a while now. I assume the invalid map rules chcks are expensive as that seems to be a problem elsewhere. To reproduce

1. Load the TS mod (almost all of the maps have custom rules)
2. Change the map
3. Immediately click start game
4. You get kicked from your own game

To avoid the problem you have to click change map, wait several seconds (on my machine) until the map actually changes. Then hit start game. It is quite annoying. Not sure if the start game button should be greyed out during map change actions or other countermeasures should take care of it.
